oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of dam and neonatal trace mineral levels in Nebraska sandhills beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, J. L.
Hickok, D. T.
Braselton, W. E.
Brink, D. R.
Olson, P. A.
Lamb, J. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: trace minerals
deficiencies
neonates
perinatal calves
copper
selenium
zinc
manganese
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Trace mineral deficiencies in copper, selenium, zinc, and manganese have been reported from neonates and perinatal calves in Western Nebraska, including the Gudmundsen Sandhills Laboratory (GSL) at Whitman, NE. Deficiencies or imbalances of trace minerals such as copper and selenium may play an independent or interacting role in the neonate's ability to produce immunity.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 183-184
